content.description: Fun gear route with a punchy crux. Taking the right-most dihedral, lieback out the roof, slam some gear in and get to the anchor! First piece off the boulder is small, like a gray C3 or a ballnut.
content.protection: Single rack; small - medium, nuts   Bolted chain anchor

content.description: The "sport route" of the wall. Begin in the same dihedral as the other routes, on gear. Then veer right on to face and follow bolts up and right. Gets progressively harder. Named after the faded red sling that hung delicately from the dihedrals to the left for who knows how long?
content.protection: Gray C3 & finger size   4 bolts   bolted chain anchor
content.location: Face right of dihderal with a thin seam.

content.description:
Exciting, all gear route with an atypical first crux followed by your standard rushmore-crystal-pinchin' crux. This takes the left most dihedral. Once through the steep liebacking and sloper boulder problem jog right underneath the roof and catch a no hands rest. Reach out left for a small blind placement in the face then fire up and left through the second crux. Take crack to anchors. Maybe a bit contrived or unusual but a fun line!

 Done in a headpoint style. Some cleaning had to be done and learning the blind placements.
content.protection: Red C3 - #2, Nuts/RPs.   Bolted chain anchor
content.location: Begin in short dihedral off boulder. Climb left side of hourglass feature.

content.description: A small collection of shorter routes right by the parking pullout. South facing wall with all gear routes and one mixed.
